text: Plyos () is a town in Ivanovo Oblast, Russia. In 2010, 2,340 people lived there. Plyos is on the right bank of the Volga River. It is northeast of Ivanovo. == History == It was founded in the 12th century. It was destroyed in 1238 by Mongols and Tatars. In 1410, Vasily I built a fortress there. It was given town status in 1925. Category:Cities and towns in Ivanovo Oblast
title: Plyos
